"Bear Brown"
"Reindeer"

string-array.name: mammal_area
string-array.item: "Rodrigues Island (off the east coast of Madagascar)"
"Northwestern North America, northern Asia, Europe, northern Africa, and the Middle East"
"Canada, Alaska, Greenland, northern Europe, and northern Asia"
"Parts of central, eastern, and southern Africa"
"Sumatra and Borneo"
"Alaska, Canada, U.S. to northern Mexico"
"Africa"
"Eastern and southern Africa"
"Eastern and southern Africa, India, Nepal, Vietnam, Malaysia, and Indonesia"
"South-central Washington, western Oregon, most of California, and western-central Nevada"

string-array.name: mammal_habitat
string-array.item: "Moist tropical forest"
"Forests, open fields, mountain highlands, semi-dessert, and tundra"
"Tundra, mountains, and woodlands"
"Grasslands and open woodlands"
"Forests"
"Forests, woodlands, and sometimes deserts"
"Savanna, semi-desert, scrubland, and mountains"
"Open savannas and grasslands near permanent water sources"
"Open grasslands and floodplains, swamps, and rain forests"
"Open areas, including rocky outcrops, fields, pastures, and sparsely wooded hillsides"

string-array.name: mammal_food
string-array.item: "Fruit, flowers, and sometimes insects"
"Roots, berries, insects, mammals, and fish"
"Leaves, lichen, fungi"
"Grass, leaves, and the bark of bushes and trees"
"Fruit, shoots, bark, leaves, seeds, and insects"
"Inner bark of trees, twigs, buds, fruits, and nuts"
"Small mammals, gazelles, antelope, zebras, ostrich eggs"
"Coarse grasses, leaves, herbs, and foliage"
"Grasses or leaves, depending on the species"
"Mostly plant material, including leaves, stems, flowers, bulbs, roots, seeds, fruits, and berries; it often damages grain, fruit, and nut crops."

string-array.name: mammal_size
string-array.item: "Body is about 13 inches long; wingspan from 29 to 30 inches"
"6 to 9 1/2 feet long, 3 to 4 feet tall at the shoulder; males are bigger than females"
"4 to 7 feet long, 31 to 59 inches tall at the shoulder"
"Males can reach 13 feet tall and weigh up to 13,000 pounds; females are smaller"
"Males: 4 1/2 feet tall; females are a little smaller"
"Body measures 2 to 3 feet; tail may be 8 to 10 inches long"
"29 to 33 inches tall at the shoulder"
"Males can reach up to 11 feet long and weigh more than 2,000 pounds."
"5 to 13 feet long, depending on species"
"About 18 inches long; up to just over 2 pounds in weight"

string-array.name: mammal_babies
string-array.item: "Pup clings to its mother until it grows too heavy to carry; flies on its own but stays near mother for about a year."
"Female gives birth to 2 cubs during the winter; they stay with their mother for about 2 years."
"A single calf is born in May or June and nurses for about 6 months."
"A calf weighs about 250 pounds at birth."
"Infants spend the first six to eight months clinging to their mother. Then they stay close to their moms until they are about eight years old."
"Porcupettes are born covered with soft quills that harden within a few days"
"Cubs are born in litters of 1 to 4 and weigh about 3 pounds each"
"Calves weigh from 50 to 90 pounds at birth."
"Females give birth to a single calf, which weighs over 100 pounds"
"An average litter is 5 to 8 pups"
